thread.title: Ryan Giggs insists Gareth Bale will not consider leaving Real Madrid for Manchester United
thread.title_full: Ryan Giggs insists Gareth Bale will not consider leaving Real Madrid for Manchester United

author: Aaron Flanagan
title: Ryan Giggs insists Gareth Bale will not consider leaving Real Madrid for Manchester United

organizations.name: real madrid for manchester united sport

text:
Sport Ryan Giggs insists Gareth Bale will not consider leaving Real Madrid for Manchester United The Welsh winger has been linked with moved back to the Premier League and United are one of the teams keeping close tabs Share Bale has little reason to consider leaving Real, according to Giggs (Photo: Helios de la Rubia) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Ryan Giggs says that he cannot see Gareth Bale leaving Real Madrid in favour of Manchester United. 
The Welsh winger has been touted as a potential big money addition to the Old Trafford squad in the coming years. 
But Bale is enjoying life at Real and returned to action following an 88-day lay-off last weekend to score in the 2-0 win over Espanyol. 
United legend Giggs says that his compatriot has little reason to walk away from Real and can't see a move happening in the foreseeable futrue. 
Speaking to BBC Wales Sport , he said: “He looks happy at Real Madrid. I don’t think he’s going anywhere at the moment. Giggs says that he can't see Bale moving Jose Mourinho (centre) could add to his arsenal of big name stars (Photo: PA) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Gareth Bale unfazed by football freestylers during workout Share this video Real Madrid's Isco puts Premier League clubs on red alert 
“From a fan’s point of view, it would be great to see him back in the Premier League. 
“The United fans would love to see him at Old Trafford. You talk about the big clubs and United is up there. 
"While he's happy there [Madrid], I can't see him leaving." Bale scored 10 minutes into his return to action last weekend (Photo: GETTY) He had faced 88 days on the sidelines (Photo: AFP) View gallery 
Bale's goal last weekend came less than 10 minutes after coming off the bench on his return to Real Madrid action. 
And, despite currently lacking match fitness, Bale believes he will feel fresher in the run-in as a result of his lengthy spell on the sidelines. 
“Every cloud has a silver lining, hopefully I am a bit fresher than maybe some others," he said. 
"It can work in my advantage to be out for a little bit, but the important thing now is to get back to 100 per cent and playing well and to help the team.” poll loading Will Gareth Bale ever play for Manchester United? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
